covfunc module¶

Created on Sun Nov 08 23:40:43 2015

@author: Ben

covfunc.covConv(a, b, lags=20)[source]¶

returns fft convolution result assumes a, b to be same length 1-d numpy arrays

covfunc.getCovMatrix(I1, Q1, I2, Q2, lags=20)[source]¶

This function was adaped from scipy.signal.fft.convolve. By Defining the number of lags one defines an interrest of region meaning any effect should happen on that oder of time scale; thus lower frequency effects cannot be displayed on that scale and can be discarded from the convolution. All input shapes need to be the same. requires an updated numpy version (1.9.0 +). # 0: <I1I1> # 1: <Q1Q1> # 2: <I2I2> # 3: <Q2Q2> # 4: <I1Q1> # 5: <I2Q2> # 6: <I1I2> # 7: <Q1Q2> # 8: <I1Q2> # 9: <Q1I2> # 10: <Squeezing>

covfunc.getCovMatrix_old(I1, Q1, I2, Q2, lags=20, extended=True)[source]¶

# Matrix index as follows: # 0: <I1I1> # 1: <Q1Q1> # 2: <I2I2> # 3: <Q2Q2> # 4: <I1Q1> # 5: <I2Q2> # 6: <I1I2> # 7: <Q1Q2> # 8: <I1Q2> # 9: <Q1I2> # 10: <Squeezing>
